summaryText: What an incredible message from Pastor Montell Jordan about the profound significance of God's names! In this powerful sermon, Pastor Jordan breaks down how names are not just labels, but powerful identifiers that reveal character, proximity, and access. He shares a hilarious personal story about mistaking Larry Fishburne for 'Lawrence', which beautifully illustrates how we often think we know someone without truly understanding them - just like how we sometimes treat God as a distant, generic concept rather than a personal, intimate relationship. The most mind-blowing revelation? Christianity is unique because God reaches out to us, not the other way around! Pastor Jordan explains that God has multiple names like Jehovah Rapha (Healer), Jehovah Jireh (Provider), each revealing a different aspect of His character. Imagine having direct access to the Creator of the universe who wants to be known personally by you! The sermon culminates in an incredible invitation to make God more than just a distant concept, but a close, personal relationship through Jesus Christ. Pastor Jordan's message is a game-changer - it's not about religious ritual, but about knowing God intimately and letting Him transform your life.
mainPoints: Names are extremely important and reveal character
There's a difference between knowing God and being known by God
Names reveal our proximity to God

versesMentioned.text: Moses said to God, 'Suppose I go to the Israelites and say to them, 'The God of your fathers has sent me to you,' and they ask me, 'What is his name?' Then what shall I tell them?' God said to Moses, 'I AM WHO I AM. This is what you are to say to the Israelites: 'I AM has sent me to you.'' God also said to Moses, 'Say this to the Israelites: 'The Lord, the God of your fathers—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob—has sent me to you. This is my name forever, the name you shall call me from generation to generation.'
Jesus answered, 'I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.'
'I am the Alpha and the Omega,' says the Lord God, 'who is, and who was, and who is to come, the Almighty.'

Monday.scripture: Psalm 9:10: 'Those who know your name trust in you, for you, Lord, have never forsaken those who seek you.'
Monday.action: Make a list of 3-5 attributes of God you've personally experienced. Reflect on moments where you felt His specific character in your life.
Monday.prayer: Father God, help me know You more intimately. Reveal Yourself to me beyond just a generic concept. Show me Your personal nature and character. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:13: 'You will seek me and find me when you seek me with all your heart.'
Tuesday.focus: Pursuing a closer relationship with God
Tuesday.action: Set aside 30 minutes for uninterrupted prayer. Instead of just talking, spend time listening and journaling what you hear.
Tuesday.prayer: Lord, I want to know You more deeply. Remove distractions and help me focus solely on our relationship. Speak to my heart. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 3:10: 'I want to know Christ—yes, to know the power of his resurrection and participation in his sufferings, becoming like him in his death.'
Wednesday.action: Study one of God's names (like Jehovah Rapha or Jehovah Jireh) and research its biblical context and personal significance.
Wednesday.prayer: God, expand my understanding of who You are. Help me see beyond surface-level knowledge and truly comprehend Your nature. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Isaiah 43:1: 'But now, this is what the Lord says—he who created you, Jacob, he who formed you, Israel: 'Do not fear, for I have redeemed you; I have summoned you by name; you are mine.'
Thursday.focus: Recognizing personal value in God's eyes
Thursday.action: Write a letter to yourself from God's perspective, highlighting His love and personal care for you.
Thursday.prayer: Heavenly Father, remind me that I'm not just a generic creation, but Your specifically designed child. Help me embrace my unique identity in You. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Psalm 100:3: 'Know that the Lord is God. It is he who made us, and we are his; we are his people, the sheep of his pasture.'
Friday.focus: Understanding belonging and intimacy with God
Friday.action: Share with a friend or journal about a time you felt God's personal presence and care in your life.
Friday.prayer: Lord, teach me to recognize Your personal involvement in my daily life. Open my eyes to Your constant presence. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 1 John 3:1: 'See what great love the Father has lavished on us, that we should be called children of God! And that is what we are!'
Saturday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection, imagining God calling you by name and speaking His love over you.
Saturday.prayer: Daddy God, thank You for choosing me, knowing me personally, and calling me Your own. Help me live in the fullness of that identity today. Amen.
